data.text:
Publish date: 2024-07-18

Table of Biography

JaVale McGee is an amazing professional basketball player for the Cleveland Cavaliers of the National Basketball Association (NBA). JaVale McGee also was in the game of college basketball for the Nevada Wolf Pack.

Early Life and Childhood

Javale McGee was born on January 19, 1988, and his birthplace is Flint, Michigan. He is an American by nationality. Likewise, his age is 36 years old. There is no more information about his family, childhood, etc. Regarding JaVale McGeeâs education, he previously joined 2 high schools in Michigan, Detroit Country Day School, and Providence Christian, before moving to Hales Franciscan High School, Chicago. In the Hales Franciscan coach Gary Londonâs opinion, McGeeâs position in college was a little forward, and he could play 2 forward positions.

He was the beginning center for the University of Nevada. After McGeeâs sophomore campaign, in which he scored 14.3 points and 7.3 rebounds, shooting 53% from the field and 33% from the three-point range, McGee decided to recruit an agent and announce for the 2008 NBA draft.

Career and Professional Life

At first, JaVale was chosen eighteenth by the Wizards in the 2008 NBA draft. On July 9, 2008, he made a deal of 2 years, a $2.4 million contract with the Wizards. McGee had to give a fine of $10 K by the Wizards for taking part in Gilbert Arenasâ antics on January 9, 2010, before a match on January 5, 2010, in which the opposite team was the Philadelphia 76ers. On January 6, 2011, McGee again was able to take part in the 2011 NBA Slam Dunk Contest. McGee was the 1st Wizard to ever take part there. Unfortunately, he lost to Blake Griffin. McGee was also the 1st player to use three balls at the same time in a dunk contest. The Guinness World Records also was mentioning him as the most basketballs dunked in one jump.

In a 98â79 loss to the Chicago Bulls on March 15, 2011. His career-high twelve blocks were the most since Keon Clark had 12 on March 23, 2001. However, he got some disapproval for taking ill-advised shots in the 4th quarter to make sure that he would score ten points while his group was being blown out, and also got a technical foul for the excessive celebration by pulling himself on the rim after a dunk for his last points. TV commentator Kevin McHale said it was a âbad triple-doubleâ. In reply, McGee said, âI got a triple-double. Who can say they got a triple-double? Iâm not worried about itâ. At the time of the 2011 NBA lockout, NBPA leaders met with around thirty players on October 14.

Furtherâ¦

JaVale quit the meeting early and told reporters there were several players âsaying that theyâre ready to foldâ, but most of them were together. Later he disagreed quoting that players were ready to fold, but his comment was recorded by reporters. Derek Fisher said McGee had âno ability to make that statementâ based on the limited time he spent at the meeting. On March 15, 2012, McGee was traded to the Nuggets together with Ronny Turiaf in an exception that dispatched NenÃª to the Wizards. As a part of the Wizards, he began 40 of 41 games in which he was present; with the Nuggets, he would begin in 5 of 20 games in which he was present. On March 21, in his Nuggets appearance, he made the game-winning dunk off an Arron Afflalo missed free throw with five seconds left on the clock.

At the finishing of the regular season, the Nuggets collected the Westâs 6th seed, and McGee was present in the 2012 NBA Playoffs, which was his 1st playoff presence in his career. McGeeâs series-high was 21 points in Game 5 against 1st-round opposite Los Angeles Lakers. McGeeâs numbers were up and down in the series. On July 18, 2012, McGee again signed with the Nuggets on a 4-year, $44 million contract. His 2013â14 season was completed on February 20, 2014, when he had surgery to fix a stress fracture in his left tibia which he underwent on November 8, 2013. On October 29, 2014, McGee went back for the Nuggets and won against the Detroit Pistons.

More about his career

On February 19, 2015, McGee was together with the rights to Chukwudiebere Maduabum and a 2015 first-round pick, to the Philadelphia 76ers in exchange for the rights to Cenk Akyol. The 76ers were refusing him after being present in 6 games on March 1, 2015. On August 13, 2015, He made a steal together with the Dallas Mavericks. He missed the groupâs 1st 13 games of the 2015â16 season because of a stress fracture in his left tibia. Also, on November 22, 2015, he made his appearance for the Mavericks, playing in under eleven minutes off the bench, recording 8 points and 6 rebounds in a loss to the Oklahoma City Thunder. On January 5, 2016, he again won against the Sacramento Kings. The Mavericks decline McGee on July 8, 2016.

McGee then made a deal with the Golden State Warriors on September 16, 2016. He then got a victory against the New York Knicks on December 15, 2016. Also, on March 31, 2017, he got a victory against the Houston Rockets. The Warriors got a victory against the 2017 NBA Championship after beating the Cleveland Cavaliers in the NBA Finals. He was in the game in 77 of 82 regular-season games. McGee re-made a deal along with the Warriors on a 1-year contract on August 1, 2017. His gaming time was enlarging when he was into the beginning lineup after the all-star break. He won his 2nd straight championship after the Warriors beat the Cavaliers in a 4-game in the Finals in June 2018. He began the final three games of the series and scored 8.0 points in the 4 games.

Some more

JaVale made a deal with the Los Angeles Lakers on July 10, 2018. He passed out 7 games in December due to a respiratory problem. On March 22, 2019, he was lost to the Brooklyn Nets. Additionally, JaVale was a swap from the Los Angeles Lakers to the Cleveland Cavaliers in a swap for Alfonzo McKinnie and Jordan Bell on November 23, 2020. McGee got an invite to the United States menâs national basketball teamâs minicamp in the summer of the year 2009 and also in the summer of 2010. McGee was playing together with Team USA in a scrimmage at Radio City Music Hall at the 2010 World Basketball Festival but after an uneven presentation, he didnât play in the teamâs scrimmage opposite China at Madison Square Garden. It ended on August 15, 2010.

McGee went to the Philippines twice during the 2011 NBA lockout, 1st in exhibition games with NBA stars against players from the Philippine Basketball Association and the Smart Gilas national team, and then in a basketball clinic. Later the same year, he showed his interest in playing for the Philippine national group. In 2012, a bill was made for his Filipino citizenship to make him eligible to play for Smart Gilas. Moreover, in the year 2014, McGee was asked again by the Gilas Pilipinas to participate as a naturalized player in the 2014 FIBA Basketball World Cup in Spain. But national groups were limited to 1 naturalized player apiece, and a Wizards member Andray Blatche made the World Cup group after he was permitted citizenship.

Net Worth 2024

The basketball player has a good net worth of around $14 million. He has a seven-figure salary as a professional NBA player. Moreover, JaVale is the new member of the Los Angeles Lakers. There he earns a salary of about $2.3 million. Furthermore, he is the owner of a house for the price of $2.425 million. He bought back the house in the year 2015.

Relationship Status

JaVale has been in a strong relationship with her girlfriend whose name is Giselle Ramirez. They have been in a serious romantic relationship since the year 2015. Together, JaVale and Giselle have a daughter and her name is Genevieve Grey McGee. However, the couple is not in a marital relationship yet. But looking at their strong relationship, the couple seems to be marrying each other very soon. Apart from these all things, the talented player is not into any kind of scandals and rumors.

JaVale McGee â Body Measurements

JaVale McGee has a very tall and suitable appearance. He stands at a height of 7 feet or 2.13 m. Likewise, he has a body weight of 270 lbs or 122 kg. Further details about the basketball playerâs body measurement, dress size, and shoe size, are still missing. Also, he has black short hair with a pair of brown eyes. Also, he has a black complexion with a dashing personality. Being a basketball player, he has good health with a very muscular body type.

JaVale McGee â Social Media

Now talking about his social media accounts, he is present all over the social media platforms. JaValehas 351.5 K followers on his Twitter account and 1.8 million followers on his Instagram account. He even has Wikipedia and his own YouTube channel. On his YouTube channel, he uploads videos where he motivates. Also, he shares his experiences in his career as a professional basketball player. We can see his love and sincerity for his career and his family as well from his social media posts.
